data.title: Pfizer stock climbs on Q4 revenue and earnings beat, reaffirmed guidance
data.description:
Pfizer Inc. (PFE) shares rose 1.7% in premarket trades Tuesday after the drug maker topped Wall Street's revenue and profit estimates in its fourth-quarter results and reaffirmed its full-year guidance.

Pfizer's adjusted fourth-quarter profit of 63 cents a share beat the FactSet consensus estimate of 47 cents a share. Revenue rose to $17.76 billion from $14.57 billion, and beat the FactSet consensus of $17.35 billion.

Pfizer also reaffirmed its full-year 2025 guidance, which includes revenue in a range of $61 billion to $64 billion and adjusted earnings between $2.80 and $3 a share.

(This is a developing news story with updates to come.)

-James Rogers

This content was created by MarketWatch, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. MarketWatch is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.description:

The Abu Dhabi-listed investment company will restart trading after it publishes the results of its meeting, according to a Tuesday release.

data.title: Silicon Laboratories Reports Fiscal Q4 Loss, Revenue Rises; Provides Q1 Guidance
data.description:
Silicon Laboratories reported a fiscal Q4 adjusted loss Tuesday of $0.11 per share. Year-ago figures were not available.

Analysts surveyed by FactSet expected a loss of $0.11.

Revenue for the quarter ended Dec. 28 was $166.2 million, compared with $86.8 million a year earlier. Analysts surveyed by FactSet expected $166.1 million.

For fiscal Q1, the company said it expects non-GAAP EPS ranging from a loss $0.19 and earnings of $0.01 on revenue of $170 million to $185 million. Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect a fiscal Q1 adjusted loss of $0.09 per share on revenue of $175.7 million.

Silicon Laboratories' shares were down 2.4% in premarket trading.

data.title: Clearstep Emerges as Most Adopted Digital Self-Triage Solution Among U.S. Health Systems
data.description:
Clearstep leads the market as the most widely adopted digital self-triage platform among U.S. health systems, according to a comprehensive study published in npj Digital Medicine

CHICAGO, IL / ACCESS Newswire / February 4, 2025 / Clearstep, a market leader in AI-powered triage and healthcare navigation for patients and capacity optimization for care teams, has been prominently featured in a recent study published in Nature Publishing Group's npj Digital Medicine. The study, titled "Contrasting Rule and Machine Learning Based Digital Self-Triage Systems in the USA", analyzes the adoption and effectiveness of digital self-triage systems across 647 U.S. health systems and reveals Clearstep as the frontrunner.

Key findings from the study include:

  • Only 7.72% of surveyed health systems have adopted self-triage solutions, indicating adoption of self-triage has moved beyond the "early innovator" phase and is in the "early adopter" phase.

  • Clearstep's platform is available on more than 2X as many health system websites as the next most adopted solution.

  • Clearstep's platform, when normalized to scale (as indicated by number of hospital regions with digital access) is available to more than 3X as many patients.

  • The adoption of self-triage solutions has increased by 57% since 2022, demonstrating rapid market growth.

This timeline traces the progression from nurse call centers to the automation of their decision rules and content. This evolution has resulted in distinct categories of AI-powered patient self-service technologies available today.

Adeel Malik, CEO and Co-founder of Clearstep, commented on the findings: "This recognition validates our commitment to improving patient access and efficiency in healthcare. As the most adopted solution, we're proud to be leading the charge in transforming how patients navigate their healthcare needs."

With an estimated 25% of annual U.S. healthcare spending wasted due to inefficiencies like unnecessary ER visits and delayed care, the need for intelligent self-triage solutions is now more urgent than ever. As online scheduling expands across health system websites and medical groups standardize provider templates, qualifying patient appointments through self-triage is essential. Digital self-triage tools are critical to addressing these challenges by empowering patients to make informed care-seeking decisions while reducing strain on providers and lowering overall costs.

The study highlights the growing importance of digital self-triage in healthcare, with benefits including:

  • Enhanced patient access & experience for navigating both clinical and non-clinical needs

  • More precise patient routing to the right care level, improving clinical outcomes

  • Better specialty & sub-specialty scheduling, reducing appointment mismatches

  • Optimized ambulatory & outpatient capacity, improving resource utilization

  • Lower call center burden by reducing unnecessary interactions via automation

  • Fewer avoidable ER visits, cutting costs & improving care efficiency

  • Strong ROI for health systems, driving financial and operational gains

"Our dedication to safely and scalably combining clinical best practice & expertise with AI-capabilities has set a new standard in digital self-triage," said Bilal Naved, Chief Product Officer and Co-Founder of Clearstep. "This study affirms that our approach not only meets but exceeds the standards for trust in deploying automated, artificially intelligent systems of modern healthcare navigation, offering a seamless experience for patients while supporting healthcare providers in delivering efficient, appropriate care."

As healthcare systems face growing demand and ongoing provider shortages, hybrid self-triage systems that bring together trusted clinical best practice guidelines with the latest advances in artificial intelligence like Clearstep's Smart Care Routing solutions will play an increasingly vital role in improving care navigation and operational efficiency.

About Clearstep

Clearstep is addressing critical challenges in healthcare access, engagement, and efficiency with its AI-powered solutions for self-triage and care navigation. By combining clinically validated protocols with advanced AI capabilities, Clearstep empowers health systems to reduce unnecessary care utilization, streamline workflows, and enhance patient outcomes. Trusted by health systems across the U.S., Clearstep's solutions are paving the way for a more accessible and efficient healthcare future.

For more information, visit clearstep.health and follow Clearstep news on LinkedIn.

For more information, contact:

Clearstep: info@clearstep.health

SOURCE: Clearstep

View the original press release on ACCESS Newswire

data.title: Graphic Packaging Holding Company Reports Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2024 Results
data.description:
Graphic Packaging Holding Company, a global leader in sustainable consumer packaging, has released its fourth quarter and full-year 2024 financial results. The company, headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, designs and produces consumer packaging primarily from renewable or recycled materials.

Financial Highlights

For the full year 2024, Graphic Packaging reported net sales of $8.807 billion, a decrease from $9.428 billion in 2023. Net income for the year was $658 million, down from $723 million in the previous year. Adjusted EBITDA also saw a decline, coming in at $1.682 billion compared to $1.876 billion in 2023. The adjusted EBITDA margin was 19.1%, slightly lower than the 19.9% reported in 2023. Earnings per diluted share (EPS) were $2.16, down from $2.34 in 2023, while adjusted EPS was $2.49, compared to $2.91 in the prior year.

Business and Operational Highlights

In 2024, the company launched its Vision 2030 initiative and achieved innovation sales growth of $205 million. Despite a challenging first half, the company returned to positive packaging volume growth in the second half of the year. Additionally, Graphic Packaging executed a Virtual Power Purchase Agreement to increase renewable energy use in Europe and repurchased 2% of its common shares outstanding, returning $322 million of capital to stockholders.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

Graphic Packaging made significant strides in its strategic initiatives, including the divestiture of the Augusta, GA bleached paperboard manufacturing facility, which impacted net sales and adjusted EBITDA. The company also announced a 10% increase in the quarterly dividend, effective for the first quarter of 2025, reflecting its commitment to returning value to shareholders.

Management's Perspective

Michael Doss, President and CEO, highlighted the company's strong and steady margins and significant new consumer packaging innovations. He emphasized the strategic investments in capabilities, innovation, and competitive advantage that have positioned the company for long-term value creation. Doss also noted that customer destocking is largely over, and the company is responding to evolving consumer needs by creating more circular, functional, and convenient packaging.

Future Outlook

Looking ahead to 2025, Graphic Packaging expects net sales to be in the range of $8.6 billion to $8.8 billion, adjusted EBITDA between $1.66 billion and $1.76 billion, and adjusted EPS from $2.48 to $2.73. The company also anticipates a significant decline in capital spending as major asset investments come to completion, allowing for the deployment of excess cash to create substantial value for stockholders.

SEC Filing: GRAPHIC PACKAGING HOLDING CO [ GPK ] - 8-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: Ball Corporation Reports Fourth Quarter 2024 Results
data.description:
Ball Corporation, a leading supplier of sustainable aluminum packaging solutions, has released its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year of 2024. The report highlights the company's performance across various segments and provides insights into its strategic initiatives and future outlook.

Financial Highlights

For the full year 2024, Ball Corporation reported net earnings attributable to the corporation of $4.01 billion, translating to a total diluted earnings per share (EPS) of $13.00. This marks a significant increase from the previous year's net earnings of $707 million and EPS of $2.23. However, the fourth quarter of 2024 saw a net loss attributable to the corporation of $32 million, or a diluted loss per share of 11 cents, compared to net earnings of $154 million and EPS of 49 cents in the same period of 2023.

Full-year comparable net earnings were $977 million, or $3.17 per diluted share, up from $920 million, or $2.90 per diluted share, in 2023. Fourth quarter comparable earnings per diluted share were 84 cents, an increase from 78 cents in the fourth quarter of 2023.

Business and Operational Highlights

Ball Corporation's beverage packaging segments in North and Central America, EMEA, and South America showed mixed results. The North and Central America segment reported full-year comparable operating earnings of $747 million on sales of $5.62 billion, while the EMEA segment reported $416 million on sales of $3.47 billion. The South America segment reported $296 million on sales of $1.95 billion.

Notably, the company returned $1.96 billion to shareholders through share repurchases and dividends in 2024. The company also recorded a noncash impairment charge related to its aluminum cup business, which is expected to be deconsolidated in early 2025.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

In 2024, Ball Corporation completed the divestiture of its aerospace business for a purchase price of $5.6 billion. This strategic shift allowed the company to focus on its core aluminum packaging business. The company is also exploring strategic partnerships for its aluminum cup business, which has not met initial growth expectations.

Additionally, Ball Corporation entered into an agreement to sell a portion of its ownership in Ball United Arab Can Manufacturing Company, expected to close in the first half of 2025. This transaction is anticipated to result in a gain of approximately $80 million.

Management's Perspective

Daniel W. Fisher, chairman and chief executive officer, commented, "We delivered strong full-year and fourth quarter results and returned $1.96 billion to shareholders in 2024. Leveraging our strong financial position and leaner operating model, the company was able to deliver on its 2024 goals and remains uniquely positioned to enable our purpose of advancing the greater use of sustainable aluminum packaging."

Howard Yu, executive vice president and chief financial officer, added, "Our company performed well and delivered on our stated comparable earnings growth goal while returning $1.96 billion to shareholders in 2024. By consistently executing on our plans to drive continuous improvement, operational excellence, and cost management, our resulting strong free cash flow will allow us to return significant value to shareholders while also prudently investing in our business over the years to come."

Future Outlook

Looking ahead to 2025, Ball Corporation aims to grow comparable diluted earnings per share by more than 10 percent, generate strong free cash flow, and continue returning value to shareholders through share repurchases and dividends. The company is focused on advancing aluminum packaging and leveraging its Ball Business System to achieve these goals.

SEC Filing: BALL Corp [ BALL ] - 8-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: Fox 2Q Profit Jumps on High Ad Spending for Sports, Politics
data.description:
By Dean Seal

Fox recorded a bigger profit in its fiscal second quarter as strong advertising revenue from the election season and sports pushed the top line above Wall Street estimates.

The broadcaster had net income of $373 million, or 81 cents a share, up from $109 million, or 23 cents a share, in the same quarter a year ago.

Stripping out one-time items, adjusted earnings were 96 cents a share. Analysts polled by FactSet had been expecting 69 cents a share.

Revenue rose 20% to $5.08 billion, above analyst projections for $4.87 billion, according to FactSet.

Fox's cable-network business, which includes Fox Sports 1, Fox Business and Fox News, posted a 31% jump in revenue from higher affiliate fees that offset a decline in subscribers. Advertising revenue was up 32% on higher news ratings, prices and digital ad sales, along with higher ratings for Major League Baseball's post-season.

The company's television segment logged 16% higher revenue thanks to the strong MLB ratings, higher prices for National Football League advertisements, political ads and growth for ad-supported video on demand at the Tubi subsidiary.

Shares rose 3.9% to $51.10 in premarket trading.

Write to Dean Seal at dean.seal@wsj.com

data.title: PennyMac Financial Services to Offer $650 Million Senior Notes Due 2033
data.description:
PennyMac Financial Services said Tuesday it plans to offer $650 million in senior notes due 2033.

Proceeds from the offering will be used to repay certain debt, including borrowings under secured MSR facilities, repurchase a portion of its 5.375% senior notes due October 2025, and for general corporate purposes, the residential mortgage company said.

PFSI shares were 1.2% lower in recent premarket activity.

data.title: Iron Ore Rises to Over 1-Month High
data.description:
Prices for iron ore cargoes with 62% iron content jumped to over $105 per tonne in February, the highest in over one month, lifted by supply setbacks and expectations of robust construction and manufacturing demand for ferrous metals among the world’s major consumers.

Cyclones in Australia forced Rio Tinto to clear iron ore ships from ports, adding to bottlenecks after the company had shipments hampered from disruptions in rail operations.

In the meantime, expectations of traction in construction activity in China following its Lunar New Year celebrations were stemmed by pledges of ample fiscal stimulus from Beijing, aiding the improved credit aggregates from the latest data.

This coincided with strong demand for steel by major Chinese trading partners, as the country exported a record-setting 9.7 million tons of steel in December, a 26% surge from the previous year.

data.title: Blink Charging Is Maintained at Equal-Weight by Barclays
PayPal falls as Q4 margin contraction clouds upbeat 2025 profit forecast
data.description:
** Payments firm PayPal's shares drop ~6% to $84.10 premarket

** PYPL's operating margin shrinks in Q4, overshadowing a strong profit forecast for 2025 as it raises concerns that co's turnaround would be sluggish

** Adjusted operating margins - a key source of investor anxiety amid rising competition in digital payments - contracted 34 basis points to 18% in Q4

** Since taking over in late 2023, CEO Alex Chriss has focused on high-margin products and touted 'profitable growth' as co's new strategy

** Co sees 2025 adjusted profit per share between $4.95 to $5.10 vs estimates of $4.90, according to data compiled by LSEG

** PYPL shares rose nearly 40% in 2024, outperforming markets and snapping a 3-year losing streak

data.title: Exchange-Traded Funds Edge Higher, Equity Futures Mixed Pre-Bell Tuesday as China Responds to US Tariffs
data.description:
The broad market exchange-traded fund SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust was up marginally by 0.04% and the actively traded Invesco QQQ Trust advanced 0.2% in Tuesday's premarket activity, as China announced retaliatory tariffs following recent US trade measures.

US stock futures were mixed, with S&P 500 Index futures up 0.04%, Dow Jones Industrial Average futures slipping 0.2%, and Nasdaq futures gaining 0.2% before the start of regular trading.

December's Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey, or JOLTS, and the factory orders bulletin for December will be released at 10 am ET.

Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic speaks at 11 am, San Francisco President Mary Daly at 2 pm, and Fed Vice Chair Philip Jefferson at 7:30 pm.

In premarket activity, bitcoin was down by 1.8% and the cryptocurrency fund ProShares Bitcoin Strategy ETF was 1.9% lower.

Power Play:

Technology

Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund gained 0.4%, and the iShares US Technology ETF was 0.5% higher, while the iShares Expanded Tech Sector ETF was flat. Among semiconductor ETFs, SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETF advanced by 0.5%, while the iShares Semiconductor ETF rose by 0.5%.

Palantir Technologies shares were up more than 21% in recent Tuesday premarket activity after the company reported higher Q4 adjusted earnings and revenue that beat FactSet analyst estimates.

Winners and Losers:

Consumer

The Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR Fund was down 0.4%, while the Vanguard Consumer Staples Fund was flat. The iShares US Consumer Staples ETF declined 0.1%, and the Consumer Discretionary Select Sector SPDR Fund slipped 0.04%. The VanEck Retail ETF and the SPDR S&P Retail ETF were inactive.

Estee Lauder shares were down 8% pre-bell after the company reported lower fiscal Q2 adjusted net earnings and net sales.

Financial

Financial Select Sector SPDR Fund declined 0.1%. Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3X Shares was down 0.5%, while its bearish counterpart Direxion Daily Financial Bear 3X Shares was 0.4% higher.

UBS Group shares were down more than 5% pre-bell Tuesday after the company reported lower-than-expected Q4 earnings and underlying revenue.

Industrial

Industrial Select Sector SPDR Fund retreated 0.03% while the Vanguard Industrials Index Fund and the iShares US Industrials ETF (IYJ) were inactive.

CNH Industrial stock was down 3.7% before the opening bell after the company posted lower Q4 adjusted earnings and net sales.

Health Care

The Health Care Select Sector SPDR Fund retreated 0.2%. The Vanguard Health Care Index Fund was flat, while the iShares US Healthcare ETF gained 1.7%. The iShares Biotechnology ETF was 0.4% lower.

Pfizer stock was up 2.1% premarket after the company reported higher Q4 adjusted earnings and revenue.

Energy

The iShares US Energy ETF was inactive, while the Energy Select Sector SPDR Fund was down by 0.3%.

Marathon Petroleum stock was up 1.4% before Tuesday's opening bell after the company reported higher-than-expected Q4 adjusted net income and revenue.

Commodities

Front-month US West Texas Intermediate crude oil declined 2.2% to $71.59 per barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange. Natural gas was down 4.2% at $3.21 per 1 million British Thermal Units. United States Oil Fund slipped by 1.8%, while the United States Natural Gas Fund fell by 4.1%.

Gold futures for April were down 0.4% at $2,846.80 an ounce on the Comex, and silver futures slipped 0.6% to $32.34 an ounce. SPDR Gold Shares were up 0.2%, while the iShares Silver Trust was 0.6% higher.

data.title: Wallenius Wilhelmsen: Invitation to Q4 2024 results presentation, live at Lysaker and online
data.description:
Wallenius Wilhelmsen is pleased to invite investors, lenders, analysts, andmedia to the presentation of our fourth quarter 2024 results.

Date: Wednesday, February 12, 2025 Time: 08:30 AM

Presenters: Lasse Kristoffersen (President & CEO) and Jermund Lien (interimCFO)The presentation will be held at Wallenius Wilhelmsen's head office, locatedat:Strandveien 20, 1366 Lysaker, Norway.

The presentation will also be streamed live as a video webcast on thefollowinglink:https://channel.royalcast.com/hegnarmedia/#!/hegnarmedia/20250212_6

Program: 08:00: Welcome + refreshments08:30: Q4 presentation, followed by Q&A

The quarterly report will be published on the Oslo Stock Exchange(www.newsweb.no) and on walleniuswilhelmsen.com on Wednesday, February 12,2025,at 07:00 AM.

Please register your participation by send a message to IR@walwil.com with thesubject "Signing up for Q4 2024 presentation".

Viewers are welcome to send in questions during the webcast. The full webcast,together with the presentation slides will be available on our website uponcompletion of the live event.

For further information, please contact:

Anders Redigh Karlsen - VP Global IR & Market InsightTel: +47 994 20 293Email: anders.karlsen@walwil.com

Idha Toft Valeur - Media Contact Tel: +47 406 05 210Email: idha.valeur@walwil.com

About Wallenius Wilhelmsen:The Wallenius Wilhelmsen group is a market leader in roll-on/roll-off (RoRo)shipping and vehicle logistics, managing the distribution of cars, trucks,rolling equipment and breakbulk to customers all over the world. The companyoperates around 125 vessels servicing 15 trade routes to six continents, aglobal inland distribution network, 66 processing centers and eight marineterminals. With a head office in Oslo, Norway, the Wallenius Wilhelmsen grouphas 9,500 employees working across 28 countries worldwide.

Read more at: walleniuswilhelmsen.com

data.title: Salesforce to Lay Off More Than 1,000 Employees, Bloomberg Reports
data.description:
• Salesforce plans to lay off more than 1,000 employees as it shifts focus to artificial-intelligence products, Bloomberg reported.
  • It couldn't be determined which units will be affected, Bloomberg reported, citing a person close to the situation.
  • Displaced workers will be able to apply for other jobs internally, according to Bloomberg.
  • Salesforce, the leading maker of customer management software, is cutting these jobs even as it hires more salespeople focused on the company's new AI agent products, Bloomberg reported.

Full article at https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-02-04/salesforce-cutting-1-000-roles-while-hiring-salespeople-for-ai

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com
